revised_title: The Action of Intermittent Radiant Heat on Gaseous Matter: A Novel Method of Investigation
tldr: John Tyndall investigates the interaction of radiant heat and gaseous matter using a novel method of exposing gases and vapors to an intermittent beam of light. He discovers that the intensity of the sound produced by the gas is directly related to its ability to absorb radiant heat, providing a new way to measure absorption.
